intro: Notopleura lanosa, commonly known as the silky notopleura, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Notopleura lanosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and understorey environments.
